@description.name: @description
@description.body: Cross browser XML document creation API The main purpose of this class is to allow you to create XML document objects in a cross-browser fashion. Use create to create an empty document, fromString to create one from an existing XML text. Both methods return a *native DOM object*. That means you use standard DOM methods on such an object (e.g. createElement). The following links provide further information on XML documents: * W3C Interface Specification * MS xml Object * MSXML GUIDs and ProgIDs * MDN Parsing and Serializing XML

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {String} ActiveX class name of DOMDocument (IE specific)

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {String} ActiveX class name of XMLHttpRequest (IE specific)

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Whether the given element is a XML document or element
which is part of a XML document.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: elem {Document|Element} Any DOM Document or Element

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the document is a XML document
@return.description: Whether the document is a XML document

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Create an XML document.

Returns a native DOM document object, set up for XML.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: namespaceUri {String ? null} The namespace URI of the document element to create or null.
@param.description: The namespace URI of the document element to create or null.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: qualifiedName {String ? null} The qualified name of the document element to be created or null.
@param.description: The qualified name of the document element to be created or null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The string passed in is parsed into a DOM document.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: str {String} the string to be parsed
